channel.title: Question about server connection
channel.description:
Why cant my brother connect to my server on his computer
the main internet source comes from my dads computer and my computer is connected to my dads computer by a cable for the internet and my brothers computer is connected to my dads computer through a wireless connection
i put my server online i can go on it but my brother cant is there a way to make it possible for my brother to play on my server as well on his computer

item.title: Question about server connection
item.dc:creator: @ScimmyScape ScimmyScape
item.description:
@ScimmyScape wrote:

Well i’ll try to teach if you don’t like then you don’t have to use
Download Ham and Www.Hamachi.Cc
Then make a account…
Download…
Install…
Then at the top there should be a number, thats your server ip.
Then go to the bottem right hand corner and hit the triangle.
Then hit create a new network.
ake a name and pass.
Do that to ure bros comp
Have him join your network though by clicking the triangle, and hitting Join a network.
Then open your server file and double click run. then use ‘localhost,’ as your ip and your ip will show up in ham. And he’ll use that ip. Confusing Soz. :\

Read full topic

item.title: Question about server connection
item.dc:creator: @ScimmyScape ScimmyScape
item.description:
@ScimmyScape wrote:

I know you have a No-Ip server, but if you have Ham downloaded make a network and have your bro join, then let him try to connect threw Ham, I’m 85% sure that way will work :s

well, sorry i have no clue

item.title: Question about server connection
item.dc:creator: @sp00nkitty sp00nkitty
item.description:
@sp00nkitty wrote:

[quote=“spid3rm4n, post:15, topic:103203”]Bah do not use your LAN address that is dumb!

You need to connect through the IP of the computer that is hosting, No 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.0 or Router IP crap - it needs to be a pure IP www.myipaddress.com.

Your brother shouldn’t need to configure anything because he is not the server, he is only connecting.

What i would do to fix the problem is run the server from his computer then connect to it from yours, if it doesn’t work then unblock ports on his box and allow the connections.

Hope this helped some what.[/quote]theres no ways im running it on his computer NO WAY!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Question about server connection
item.dc:creator: @spid3rm4n spid3rm4n
item.description:
@spid3rm4n wrote:

Bah do not use your LAN address that is dumb!

You need to connect through the IP of the computer that is hosting, No 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.0 or Router IP crap - it needs to be a pure IP www.myipaddress.com.

Your brother shouldn’t need to configure anything because he is not the server, he is only connecting.

What i would do to fix the problem is run the server from his computer then connect to it from yours, if it doesn’t work then unblock ports on his box and allow the connections.

Hope this helped some what.

Read full topic

item.title: Question about server connection
item.dc:creator: @Kitno Kitno
item.description:
@Kitno wrote:

Any anti-virus software and firewall software (including windows!) needs to be turned off. Try that on his computer and see if it works… Try it on yours too.

Read full topic

item.title: Question about server connection
item.dc:creator: @t3h_0wn4g3 t3h 0wn4g3
item.description:
@t3h_0wn4g3 wrote:

[quote=“ScimmyScape, post:9, topic:103203”]Gahh, idk how to exsplain it, uhm.
Your brothers Computer has a firewall.
Try turning it off for a minuite.
And try logging in.
if it doesn’t work put it back up.[/quote]
exactly-
what he means is a firewall is protecting your brother from logging on because it thinks your server could be a threat-
do exactly what scimmy said-
turn it off for a minute- let him retry.
if it doesn’t work, put it back up

Read full topic
